intro: Gnaphalium papillosum, commonly known as the hairy everlasting, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow to orange flowers that are surrounded by white, fluffy bracts, giving it a soft, cotton-like appearance. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Gnaphalium papillosum is also known for its aromatic properties and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
